item.title: Code Meets Culture: Analyzing Hari Raya Music with YouTube API in R
item.description: An R>aya Meetup and sharing session of how I used Web APIs in R

item.title: About
item.description:
Iâ€™m currently working in product development and data analysis, with a strong interest in both data science and cybersecurity. I enjoy turning real-world problems into streamlined digital solutions and uncovering patterns in data to drive better decisions.

I hold a degree in Mathematics from Universiti Brunei Darussalam, where my final year research focused on the spatio-temporal analysis of advertised house prices in Brunei, using R for modeling and visualization. This project sparked my ongoing passion for data storytelling and practical analytical tools.

item.description: Feel free to reach out via Email or LinkedIn.

item.title: Warren Buffett Financial Ratio Checker
item.description:
Financial Ratios Evaluated

This tool evaluates companies based on the following ratios, each contributing to the overall investment score:

1. Return on Equity (ROE) - 15 points

Measures how effectively a company uses shareholders’ equity. Buffett prefers companies with ROE consistently above 15%.

2. Debt-to-Equity Ratio - 15 points

Lower debt means less financial risk. Buffett prefers companies with debt-to-equity ratio below 0.5.

3. Current Ratio - 10 points

Measures short-term liquidity. A ratio above 1.5 indicates good ability to cover short-term obligations.
